CRS.src.server.database

Class SqlServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • CRS.src.server.database.SqlServer

  • public class SqlServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This was initially programmed for a MariaDB implementation of MYSql. It should still work as expected, even for a Mysql server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SqlServer(java.lang.String sqlServerLocation, java.lang.String schema, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Initialize the connection to an SQL server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SqlServer

        public SqlServer(java.lang.String sqlServerLocation,
                 java.lang.String schema,
                 java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Initialize the connection to an SQL server.
        Parameters:
        sqlServerLocation - The SQL address, for jdbc.
        schema - The SQL database/schema, the thing that contains the tables.
        username - The user of the SQL server.
        password - The password for the SQL server user.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown when an SQL issue comes up.

                           java.lang.String password)

        Parameters:
        username - The sql server user
        password - the sql server user password.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Error, unable to properly connect to server.

        courseName - The course name that will get a prereq
        courseNum - the course num that will get a prereq
        requisiteName - the course name of the prereq
        requisiteNum - the course number of the prereq

      • addLecture

        public void addLecture(java.lang.String course,
                       int courseNum,
                       int lecId,
                       int cap)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds a new lecture for a course to the database
        Parameters:
        course - The course name that will get a new lecture
        courseNum - The course number that will get a new lecture
        lecId - The lecture's id
        cap - the max amount of students in the lecture.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Communication error / improper connection

                            int courseNum,
                            int studentId,
                            int lectureId)

        Parameters:
        course - The course name for the registration
        courseNum - The course number for the registration
        studentId - The student id, who is registered
        lectureId - The lecture id that the student is registered to.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Communication error / improper connection

                               int courseNum,
                               int studentId,

        Parameters:

        courseNum - the course number that is registered to
        studentId - The student that is registered
        lectureId - The lecture that is registered to.

      • setCourseRequisites

        public void setCourseRequisites(Course course,
                                java.util.ArrayList<Course> courses)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Connects a given course to all of the prereqs defined in the database
        Parameters:
        course - The course to load all of the lectures for
        courses - The course list, which must contain the prereq course.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Communication error / improper connection

      • setCourseRegistrations

        public void setCourseRegistrations(Course course,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<Student> students)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Registers for the course, all students that are taking it.
        Parameters:
        course - The course, should have some lectures contained.
        students - The student list, which should contain some students that are taking this course.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Communication error / improper connection

      • setStudentRegistrations

                                    java.util.ArrayList<Course> courses)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Registers a student for the courses that they might be taking.
        Parameters:
        student - The student to register for
        courses - The course list, which should have some courses that the student will take.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Communication error / improper connection
